title.narrative: 4. Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: By 2022, women and children affected by the security crisis have received adequate and coordinated water, hygiene and sanitation assistance, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Climate Change, Disaster Risks And Envionmental Degradation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Reducing Child Poverty, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices (Covid), Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children living in rural areas have improved access to quality water, a healthy environment and sustainable sanitation facilities in communities, in schools, and at health centres.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, women and children affected by the security crisis have received adequate and coordinated water, hygiene and sanitationassistance

description.narrative: UNICEF Burkina Faso WASH Emergency interventions combine rapid response with medium term resilience-building strategies, through the Humanitarian-Development Nexus programming. In 2021, UNICEF and its partners achieved 30 per cent of the annual water targets, 25 per cent of sanitation targets and more than 70 per cent of hygiene targets through emergency WASH services, including COVID-19 response, in the five priority regions (Centre-Nord, North, Sahel, Est and Boucle du Mouhoun). Additionally, the CO continued to lead the WASH cluster contributing significantly to the overall humanitarian program and COVID-19 response, reaching a total of 501,404 people through awareness activities across the country. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/01/2022
